pages.title: Grants

content.text: Grants usually fund one-of initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.
[Provide a brief overview of the project's goals and objectives for which the grant is being sought.]
[Explain how the proposed project aligns with the overall goals and values of the community.]
[Detail the specific activities, tasks, or deliverables that the grant will support.]
[Provide a proposed timeline for project completion, including key milestones and deadlines.]
[Specify the amount of the grant requested and provide a breakdown of how the funds will be allocated.]
[Explain the rationale behind each budget item and how it contributes to the success of the project.]
[List the key team members involved in the project, including their roles and expertise.]
[Highlight the relevant experience and qualifications of the project team members.]
[Specify the measurable goals and outcomes of the project that the grant will help achieve.]
[Explain how the project will positively impact the community.]
[List the metrics that will be used to measure the success of the project and how they will be tracked.]
[Outline a schedule for project updates and reporting to the community and grant providers.]
[Describe how the community will be involved in or benefit from the project.]
[Explain how feedback from the community will be collected and considered during the project.]
[Specify the deadline for community feedback or approval.]
[Outline the process for community members to provide feedback or suggestions.]
[Include any additional information, notes, or considerations relevant to the Grant proposal.]

pages.contentText: Grants usually fund one-of initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.Project DescriptionObjective: [Provide a brief overview of the project's goals and objectives for which the grant is being sought.]Alignment with Community Goals: [Explain how the proposed project aligns with the overall goals and values of the community.]Project DetailsScope of Work: [Detail the specific activities, tasks, or deliverables that the grant will support.]Timeline: [Provide a proposed timeline for project completion, including key milestones and deadlines.]BudgetGrant Amount Requested: [Specify the amount of the grant requested and provide a breakdown of how the funds will be allocated.]Budget Justification: [Explain the rationale behind each budget item and how it contributes to the success of the project.]Project TeamProject Team Members: [List the key team members involved in the project, including their roles and expertise.]Relevant Experience: [Highlight the relevant experience and qualifications of the project team members.]Expected OutcomesMeasurable Goals: [Specify the measurable goals and outcomes of the project that the grant will help achieve.]Impact on the Community: [Explain how the project will positively impact the community.]Evaluation and ReportingPerformance Metrics: [List the metrics that will be used to measure the success of the project and how they will be tracked.]Reporting Schedule: [Outline a schedule for project updates and reporting to the community and grant providers.]Community EngagementCommunity Involvement: [Describe how the community will be involved in or benefit from the project.]Feedback Mechanism: [Explain how feedback from the community will be collected and considered during the project.]ApprovalApproval Deadline: [Specify the deadline for community feedback or approval.]Community Feedback: [Outline the process for community members to provide feedback or suggestions.]Additional Notes[Include any additional information, notes, or considerations relevant to the Grant proposal.]

children.contentText: You can restrict access to this page and subpages using role-based access control.  1. Create a role for exclusive accessClick Settings in the left side menuClick Roles & Permissions, then Add a role 2. Build an invite link and include roleClick Invite Members in the left side menuClick AddYou can choose to add a Private link or a Token GateAttach exclusive access role to the link you create. Members who join your space through this link will be assigned the attached role.Share invite link with members who should have access to the exclusive content on this page and subpages. 3. Set page permissionsClick Share in the upper right corner of this pageRemove access from EveryoneInvite your exclusive access role with the desired permissions level
